                                                                                                                                  Question 33 of 50 Question ID: 506125121

                                                                                                                                  At the sprint planning meeting, the scrum master reiterates that if by the end of the sprint the product increment that the agile project team is building does not meet the criteria specified at the beginning of the sprint, this work will not be included in the velocity for the current sprint.

                                                                                                                                  What does the scrum master refer to?

                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                  The scenario is ultimately providing the description of the definition of done (DoD). According to the references provided, the Definition of Done (DoD) is a team's checklist of all the criteria required to be met so that a deliverable can be considered ready for customer use. The DoD for a product increment to be developed by the agile team is created by the team members at the beginning of each sprint. If the team fails to meet these criteria, their work would not count towards the velocity of the current sprint and would most likely be rejected. According to The Scrum Guide™, "When a Product Backlog item or an Increment is described as 'Done', everyone must understand what 'Done' means. Although this varies significantly per Scrum Team, members must have a shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete, to ensure transparency. This is the definition of 'Done' for the Scrum Team and is used to assess when work is complete on the product Increment."



                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Estimate to complete is the expected cost to finish all the remaining project work. The scenario refers to the criteria specified at the beginning of the sprint that determines if the work will or will not be included in the velocity for the current sprint. These criteria do not include the expected cost to finish all the remaining project work.

                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                  Correct. The definition of done is a shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete. It is the checklist established by the team members at the beginning of the project or sprint that specifies the criteria required to be met so that a deliverable developed during the project or sprint can be considered ready for the customer use.

                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. The project exit criteria are the conditions, which, if met, would result in the project or phase successful closure or early termination. Those criteria are specified in the project charter and apply to the project as a whole rather than to a specific sprint, particular deliverable, or product increment.

                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Quality metrics are a project document and one of the outputs from the Plan Quality Management process. A quality metric describes a project or product attribute and how the Control Quality process will verify compliance with it. Quality metrics are typically not used in agile projects like the one described in the scenario.

                                                                                                                                  Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                  Task: 2.7 Plan and manage quality of products/deliverables
                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                  +Reference:

                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6 DELIVERY PERFORMANCE DOMAIN
                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.2.2 Scope Definition
                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.3 QUALITY
                                                                                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, GLOSSARY, 2. DEFINITIONS
                                                                                                                                  The Software Project Manager's Bridge to Agility, Michele Sliger, Stacia Broderick, 2008, Definition of Done
                                                                                                                                  Additional resources: https://www.scrumguides.org/scrum-guide.html

                                                                                                                                      Question 34 of 50 Question ID: 506113436

                                                                                                                                      As the agile project progresses, it becomes evident that the user stories are not sufficiently tested. At the iteration retrospective meeting, the team conducts a why-why analysis and determines the root cause of the issue.

                                                                                                                                      Which of the following was the most likely root cause found by the team?

                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                      The definition of done includes the tasks that are necessary to complete the user story, as well as tasks to test the specific functionality. Code reviews, different levels of testing, and other criteria that the team feels are required to deliver a high-quality product should be specified in the definition of done of a user story. The definition of done is a checklist of tasks that must be performed by the team for each user story. It indicates a team consensus for a user story to be 100% complete and ready to be delivered to the customer.

                                                                                                                                      Note, the why-why analysis described in the scenario is a data representation technique that can be used to find a root cause for the identified issues. Other names for the why-why analysis (or diagram) include the cause-and-effect, fishbone, and Ishikawa diagram.



                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. An agile project is characterized by flexible project scope, where overall project scope is typically vague at any given point in time except for the user stories planned for the current sprint. The user stories in the current sprint backlog should be described in detail to enable sufficient testing and acceptance during the sprint.

                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Tacit knowledge is the undocumented information that is collectively known by a group of people. Although some testing knowledge may be tacit rather than explicit knowledge, the lack of the tacit knowledge as a whole, is unlikely to be the main reason for user stories not to be sufficiently tested.

                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                      Correct. The definition of done is created by the agile project team, and is a description of the mandatory steps that must be completed within a user story to indicate that the user story is 100% tested and is ready to be delivered to the customer.

                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Poor communication may cause poor performance, and therefore it is possible for poor osmotic communication to contribute to poorly tested user stories. However, among the choices given, poor osmotic communication is unlikely to be the main cause of insufficiently tested user stories.

                                                                                                                                      Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                      Task: 2.7 Plan and manage quality of products/deliverables
                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.2.2 Scope Definition
                                                                                                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, GLOSSARY, 2. DEFINITIONS
                                                                                                                                      The Software Project Manager's Bridge to Agility, Michele Sliger, Stacia Broderick, 2008, Definition of Done

                                                                                                                                          Question 35 of 50 Question ID: 506112168

                                                                                                                                          Which of the following best describes interviews when they are used as part of the Plan Quality Management process?

                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                          Interviews are an example of a data gathering technique that can be used during the Plan Quality Management process to collect project and product quality needs and expectations. Project and product quality needs and expectations, implicit and explicit, formal and informal, can be identified by interviewing experienced project participants, stakeholders, and subject matter experts. Interviews should be conducted in an environment of trust and confidentiality to encourage honest and unbiased contributions. The incorrect answer choices describe characteristics of other tools and techniques associated with the Plan Quality Management process.

                                                                                                                                          Note, interviews should be conducted in an environment of trust and confidentiality regardless of the process in which they are to be used.



                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                          Correct. Interviews should be conducted in an environment of trust and confidentiality to encourage honest and unbiased contributions.

                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Benchmarking, not interviews, involves comparing the project's quality standards to those of comparable projects to identify best practices, generate ideas for improvement and provide a basis for measuring performance.

                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Brainstorming, rather than interviews, can be used to gather data creatively from a group of team members or subject matter experts.

                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. A cost-benefit analysis, as opposed to interviews, will help the project manager determine if the planned quality activities are cost-effective.

                                                                                                                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                          Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                          Task: 1.9 Collaborate with stakeholders
                                                                                                                                          PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                          +Reference:

                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.3 QUALITY

                                                                                                                                              Question 36 of 50 Question ID: 506125037

                                                                                                                                              Several product increments recently completed by the agile team during the last few iterations have been suffering from the defects detected in customer production environment.

                                                                                                                                              What course of action would an agile practitioner recommend to the team to take in order to determine the reason causing this issue?

                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                              The Five Why's is a technique used by agile teams to determine the cause-and-effect relationships involved in a particular problem in order to get to the root causes of the problem. Typically, the Five Why's technique is used by agile teams to generate insights in an iteration, release, or project retrospective. The team members work in pairs or small groups to look at issues. They ask "Why?" five times to get beyond habitual thinking and reach the real cause of the problem. Of the choices provided, carrying out the Five Why's exercise will likely help the team determine the reason causing defects being released into customer production environment and, therefore, is the best answer to the question asked.



                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. There is not enough information in the question to assume that a lack of coding standards is the cause of the issue described in the scenario.

                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                              Correct. The Five Why's is a technique used by agile teams to determine the cause-and-effect relationships involved in a particular problem in order to get to the root causes of the problem.

                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Agile encourages peers code review, continuous integration, automated testing. Manual testing is better than nothing, however, this choice describes only one aspect of agile best practices. There is not enough information in the question to determine if testing (either manual, or automatic, or lack of any) was the reason for the defects.

                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                              Incorrect: Limiting code integration to senior developers only would likely create bottlenecks.

                                                                                                                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                              Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                              Task: 2.7 Plan and manage quality of products/deliverables
                                                                                                                                              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                              Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 5.2.1 RETROSPECTIVES
                                                                                                                                              Agile Retrospectives Making Good Teams Great, Esther Derby, Diana Larsen, 2006, Five Whys

                                                                                                                                                  Question 37 of 50 Question ID: 506110035

                                                                                                                                                  Monthly audits were performed to determine if project activities comply with corporate policies, procedures, and best practices. Throughout the project, the results of the monthly audits indicated that the team was in compliance. However, at the end of the project, it was determined that some of the project activities did not comply with organizational policies.

                                                                                                                                                  What most likely caused these compliance gaps to be missed during the audits?

                                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                  An audit is a structured, independent process used to determine if project activities comply with organizational and project policies, processes, and procedures. A quality audit is usually conducted by a team external to the project, such as the organization's internal audit department, project management office (PMO), or by an auditor external to the organization. Having a project team member perform the audit negates the benefits of an independent review and might introduce bias. For example, if the project team member conducting the audit is not aware or misinterprets a particular procedure during project execution, then that same individual will not identify the problem during the audit. Thus, it is best to have an audit performed by an entity external to the project. Therefore, of the choices provided, the most likely reason these compliance gaps were not found during the audits was that the audits were conducted by a project team member.



                                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. It is entirely appropriate for an audit to be performed by an internal audit department. Therefore, this action is unlikely to be the cause of the problem identified in the scenario, making this choice an incorrect answer.

                                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                                  Correct. An audit is usually performed by an entity external to the team. Having a project team member perform the audit negates the benefits of an independent review making this choice the best answer to the question asked.

                                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Performing audits is a typical function for a PMO and is not a likely cause for missing the compliance issues.

                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. External auditors are commonly used to ensure compliance with policies, procedures, and best practices. There is no reason to believe that using an external auditor could cause the problem outlined in this scenario.

                                                                                                                                                  Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                  Domain: 3. Business Environment
                                                                                                                                                  Task: 3.1 Plan and manage project compliance
                                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                  +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.5.1 PROJECT PROCESSES
                                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.3 Manage Quality
                                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques

                                                                                                                                                      Question 38 of 50 Question ID: 506125123

                                                                                                                                                      What is at the heart of continuous improvement of most agile projects?

                                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                      PDCA (Plan-Do-Check-Act) by Edward Deming, is the model at the heart of most Agile projects with regard to continuous improvement. The Plan-Do-Check-Act Cycle is a four-step model for carrying out change. Just as a circle has no end, the PDCA cycle should be repeated again and again for continuous improvement.



                                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. A learning cycle is a concept of how people learn from experience. It is not specific to projects.

                                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. DMAIC (an acronym for Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, and Control) refers to a data-driven improvement cycle used for improving, optimizing and stabilizing business processes and designs. The DMAIC improvement cycle is the core tool used to drive Six Sigma projects and not most agile projects.

                                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                                      Correct. The Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) cycle is a repetitive four-stage model for continuous improvement in business process management. The PDCA model is also known as the Deming circle.

                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. The Theory of Constraints (TOC) is a management paradigm that views any manageable system as being limited in achieving more of its goals by a very small number of constraints. While it is often used on projects, it is not at the heart of continuous improvement on most agile projects.

                                                                                                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                      Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                                      Task: 2.7 Plan and manage quality of products/deliverables
                                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.8 BUILD QUALITY INTO PROCESSES AND DELIVERABLES
                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.3 QUALITY
                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.4.3.4 Implement Ongoing Improvement
                                                                                                                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, GLOSSARY, 2. DEFINITIONS
                                                                                                                                                      Lean-Agile Software Development: Achieving Enterprise Agility, Alan Shalloway, Guy Beaver, James R. Trott, 2010, Plan-Do-Check-Act Cycle
                                                                                                                                                      Additional resources: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDCA

                                                                                                                                                          Question 39 of 50 Question ID: 507000048

                                                                                                                                                          A software development project was plagued with defects throughout development and even after delivery. The project ran significantly over budget due to the cost of quality. During the project retrospective, the scrum master conducts an analysis that helps identify and focus on the costliest defects.

                                                                                                                                                          Which of the following did the scrum master most likely apply?

                                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                          Effective project leaders build quality into processes and deliverables. The cost of quality can be broken down into conformance costs, which include prevention and appraisal costs, and non-conformance costs, which include internal and external failures. Typically, the later a defect is found, the more costly it is to correct as more stakeholders and project components can be impacted. Thus, the most expensive category included in the cost of quality would be external failures, also known as escaped defects. Costs associated with escaped defects not only include the cost of remediation but also include things such as loss of reputation, loss of customers, return costs, etc. Therefore, of the available choices, the scrum master most likely focused on the escaped defects as they are to be the costliest.

                                                                                                                                                          Note, the type of analysis or the tool the scrum master used (such as the five whys, cost-benefit, fishbone diagram, and root cause) is irrelevant to the selection of the correct answer. The idea behind this question is to understand that if the quality is not built into the processes and deliverables, the cost of fixing defects and/or making changes increases almost exponentially as the project progresses. Hence, understanding the various types of costs and when in the project life cycle they are incurred is the key to answering this question correctly.



                                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Appraisal costs are incurred to determine the degree of conformance to quality requirements as part of quality assurance efforts during product development and testing. The cost of quality often increases as the project progresses. Thus, costs incurred during product development and testing are not likely to be the costliest.

                                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Prevention costs are costs incurred to keep defects out of a product. Prevention costs are planned and incurred before the actual operation. The later a defect is found, the more costly it is to correct. Since prevention costs are incurred early in the project life cycle, this category is not likely to be the costliest.

                                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Internal failures are a cost of non-conformance that are incurred before the product is released to the customer. Defects discovered earlier in the project life cycle are less costly than those uncovered later. Thus, internal failure costs are typically lower than external failure costs. Note, the fishbone diagram is irrelevant to answering this question.

                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                          Correct. Escaped defects, also known as external failures, are defects that are found after the product has been released to the customer. The later a defect is discovered, the more expensive it is to remediate. Escaped defects are typically the most costly to rectify, making this choice the best answer to the question asked.

                                                                                                                                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                          Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                                          Task: 2.7 Plan and manage quality of products/deliverables
                                                                                                                                                          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                          +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.8 BUILD QUALITY INTO PROCESSES AND DELIVERABLES
                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.3.1 Cost of Quality
                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.4.1 DATA GATHERING AND ANALYSIS
                                                                                                                                                          End Exam

                                                                                                                                                              Question 40 of 50 Question ID: 506112036

                                                                                                                                                              An agile team has just completed the development of the final project's deliverable. The team members are seeking advice from the project manager as to their next step.

                                                                                                                                                              What should the project manager advise the team to do next?

                                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                              In this scenario, the project team has just completed the final deliverable that has been developed using an agile project management framework. At this point, the project manager needs to ensure that the completed deliverables meet the previously agreed definition of done to verify they meet the project's requirements. The definition of done can be described as a team's checklist of all the criteria requirement to be met so that a deliverable can be considered ready for customer use. All of the incorrect answer choices represent actions that would not be conducted immediately following the completion of project deliverables.



                                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. The acceptance criteria should have been determined early in the project before work begins on developing the project's deliverables. It would not make sense to determine the acceptance criteria after the deliverables have been completed.

                                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. The definition of ready (DoR) refers to a team's checklist for a user-centric requirement that has all the information that the team needs to begin working on it. The scenario does not describe the beginning of the work; rather, the project team has already completed all of the project deliverables.

                                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Although the project team should hold a project retrospective, the team should first ensure that the deliverables meet the established acceptance criteria.

                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                              Correct. Once the project team has completed the development of the deliverables, the deliverables should be checked to ensure they meet the previously established definition of done (DoD).

                                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.6.3 QUALITY

                                                                                                                                                                  Question 41 of 50 Question ID: 508115007

                                                                                                                                                                  A PM has been given a project where a company is developing a medical device that monitors patients’ vital signs in real-time and integrates with an application for remote monitoring by healthcare providers. The device has a target end date, but the application is missing some development provisions.

                                                                                                                                                                  What approach might work best for the team?

                                                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                  The hybrid life cycle approach leverages the strengths of waterfall and agile methods. The waterfall approach ensures the hardware development is on schedule and meets all regulatory standards and clarity. The agile approach allows the software to adapt to changing requirements and user feedback through an incremental development delivery. This integrated strategy ensures that both components are developed efficiently, effectively, and cohesively, leading to a successful project outcome.

                                                                                                                                                                  A strictly sequential approach does not allow for flexibility in accommodating the missing development provisions for the application. It may result in delays or difficulties in integrating new requirements as they emerge.

                                                                                                                                                                  An adaptive approach may lack the structured planning and sequencing necessary for cohesive development across hardware and software components. Without a clear roadmap, the project may face coordination challenges and difficulties in effectively integrating the two aspects.

                                                                                                                                                                  Segregating the project into distinct stages may delay integrating the hardware and software components. Without concurrent development and continuous integration, the project timeline may be jeopardized.



                                                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                                                  Correct. The predictive nature of the waterfall approach ensures that the hardware development follows a structured plan, allowing the team to meet the target end date and comply with regulatory standards. The adaptive approach provides flexibility in accommodating unknown requirements, allowing the team to develop the software iteratively and incorporate user feedback and evolving needs to ensure the application meets user expectations. This hybrid life cycle allows for efficient development and addressing specific needs to ensure project success.

                                                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. A strictly sequential approach does not provide flexibility or adaptability to accommodate changes or unknown requirements that may arise during the project. There is a risk of delays in integrating hardware and software components. This may result in coordination challenges and difficulties in ensuring that the final product effectively meets the project objectives.

                                                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. An adaptive approach allows for iterative development, but it may not ensure the thorough documentation and testing required to meet stringent regulatory standards for the medical device. Iterative development cycles may extend the project timeline, making meeting the fixed end date difficult.

                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Segregating the project into distinct stages may lead to delays or challenges in effectively integrating the hardware and software components. This lack of concurrent development and continuous integration may hinder the overall project progress and success. Relying solely on a phased approach will not incorporate the strengths of a hybrid approach to this type of project.

                                                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4 Models, Methods, and Artifacts

                                                                                                                                                                      Question 42 of 50 Question ID: 508115008

                                                                                                                                                                      A team has developed a prototype with a few features of their product. The customer would like to understand a portion of the work.

                                                                                                                                                                      How might the team leverage feedback to allow the customer to see a finished piece of the work?

                                                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                      Agile principles advocate for involving customers throughout the development process to ensure that the product meets their needs and expectations. By withholding the product until all features are fully developed, the team denies customers the chance to provide input early on, potentially leading to misalignment between the product and customer needs.

                                                                                                                                                                      Releasing a product with a mix of features necessary for initial user validation might hinder the Agile principle of leveraging feedback to see a finished piece of the work. It may also risk errors between user expectations and product development efforts.

                                                                                                                                                                      The agile methodology emphasizes iterative development, where the product evolves through continuous feedback and adaptation. By focusing solely on delivering all planned features upfront, the team misses out on opportunities to incorporate user feedback into the development process. This approach restricts the team's ability to iterate on the product based on real-world usage and evolving user needs.

                                                                                                                                                                      The agile methodology advocates for iterative development, where the product evolves through incremental releases based on feedback. Delivering a single feature allows the team to focus on a specific aspect of the product, ensuring that it's well-designed, functional, and aligned with user needs before moving on to additional features. The final iterative approach enables continuous improvement and ensuresthat the final product meets the customer's expectations. This approach might also allow the customer to take a portion or all of the product to the marketplace sooner.



                                                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Waiting to launch the product until all known and unknown feature requirements are understood prolongs the time to market. Agile principles prioritize delivering value to customers quickly and adapting to changing requirements and market conditions. Delaying the launch, the team misses opportunities to capture market share, respond to competitors, and generate revenue.

                                                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Releasing a product with a mix of several features increases the risk of scope creep, where additional features may be added beyond what is necessary for initial user validation. Agile methodology emphasizes delivering the minimum features required to provide value to customers and validate assumptions. Introducing too many features upfront may lead to unnecessary complexity and delay in delivering a functional product.

                                                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Prioritizing the delivery of all planned features without considering user feedback increases the risk of over-engineering the product. Suppose the team does not validate the needs or relevance of each feature through user feedback. In that case, it is more likely to invest time and resources in developing features that may not effectively contribute to the product's value proposition or address user needs. This can result in unnecessary complexity and wasted effort.

                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                      Correct. The agile methodology of the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) emphasizes getting customer feedback and delivering value to customers quickly and iteratively. Providing the customer with a single feature allows the team to expedite the delivery process and get a product into the hands of users sooner. This speed of market is essential for gaining a competitive advantage and capturing market share, as customers can start benefiting from the product's value proposition sooner rather than later.

                                                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.3.7 INTERACTIONS WITH OTHER PERFORMANCE DOMAINS

                                                                                                                                                                          Question 43 of 50 Question ID: 506113728

                                                                                                                                                                          You have been requested to provide information on your project’s activities and processes to a unit within your company but external to the project. This group of individuals will compare the information to organizational and project policies, processes and procedures and identify good and best practices being used as well as nonconformity, gaps, and shortcomings within project activities and processes.

                                                                                                                                                                          What tool or technique is being conducted by the external team?

                                                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                          Audits which are defined as structured, independent processes assist project management in determining if project activity and processes comply with the policies and procedures prescribed. During the Manage Quality process, the data and results from the Control Quality process are used to determine the overall quality of the project work. The quality status is made available to the project stakeholders. Audits are one of many tools used to manage quality and increase the probability of meeting quality objectives and identify ineffective processes that cause poor quality.



                                                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                                                          Correct. The question references an external team requiring project activity information. Per the guide, audits are usually conducted by teams independent of the project whose purpose is to determine if project activities comply with set project and organizational standards.

                                                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Statistical sampling is a tool or technique used in the Control Quality process and is not the process being conducted by the external team in this scenario.

                                                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. The information in the question describes a process to conduct a comparison of activities which is more of an assessment or audit than a type of analysis.

                                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. The question does not indicate that there are issues or challenges that require resolution, which is the primary purpose of problem solving.

                                                                                                                                                                          Task: 3.1 Plan and manage project compliance
                                                                                                                                                                          PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                                              Question 44 of 50 Question ID: 506112076

                                                                                                                                                                              A project manager is implementing the quality management plan for a project to construct a natural gas pipeline. During this process, an internal audit discovers that while the project meets all applicable government regulations, there is a discrepancy with ISO 9000 criteria.

                                                                                                                                                                              Which tailoring consideration did the project manager most likely neglect earlier in the project?

                                                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                              The question implies that the project manager is performing the Manage Quality process by implementing the quality management plan. Tailoring considerations for the quality management processes include standards and regulatory compliance, among others. The question states that an internal audit uncovered a discrepancy with International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 9000 standards. ISO 9000 represents a set of industry standards, which are widely followed by organizations. Many organizations have policies requiring adherence to ISO quality standards as an ISO certified organization. The tailoring consideration of standards and regulatory compliance includes industry standards of which ISO 9000 is an example. The fact that the discrepancy was uncovered during an internal audit implies that the performing organization complies with ISO 9000 standards, otherwise there would be no reason to include this review in an audit. Therefore, of the available choices, the project manager most likely neglected the tailoring consideration of standards and regulatory compliance earlier in the project.



                                                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Continuous improvement should be integrated into the quality management plan for any project. However, the question is asking about compliance with industry standards (ISO 9000 in this case), which is unrelated to continuous improvement.

                                                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                                                              Correct. ISO 9000 represents a set of industry standards, which are widely followed by organizations. Although not required by law, many organizations have policies requiring adherence to ISO 9000 quality standards. The tailoring consideration of standards and regulatory compliance includes industry standards such as ISO 9000 standards.

                                                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Project life cycle addresses what phases, if any, should comprise the project. ISO 9000 represents industry standards, which exist independently of project life cycle.

                                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Even if not required by law, following ISO 9000 standards may be required by company policy. Therefore, adhering to ISO 9000 standards may still be a project requirement. The fact that the discrepancy was uncovered during an internal audit implies that the performing organization complies with ISO 9000 standards. Otherwise, there would be no reason to include this review in the audit.
